MonumentDescription: Located in Sbiba, Kasserine region, Tunisia, this mosque is a historic religious building named after Sidi Okba Ibn Nafi.
A well-preserved Roman amphitheater used for gladiatorial contests and public spectacles.
A defensive structure built during the Byzantine era to protect the city from invaders.
An ancient tomb from the Numidian period, known for its unique funerary inscriptions.
A historic water transport system built by the Romans to supply fresh water to Sbiba.
